com.defano.jmonet.tools

Class MagnifierTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.builder.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.MagnifierTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, KeyListener, EventListener

    public class MagnifierTool
extends PaintTool
    Tool that changes the scale factor of the canvas and adjusts the scroll position to re-center the scaled image in the scrollable viewport.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MagnifierTool()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getMagnificationStep()
      Gets the value by which the canvas scale factor is multiplied or divided when zooming in or zooming out.
      double getMaximumScale()
      Gets the maximum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to.
      double getMinimumScale()
      Gets the minimum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to.
      Cursor getZoomCursor()
      Gets the cursor displayed when the user presses the control or meta key (indicating they wish to reset the canvas scale to 1.0).
      Cursor getZoomInCursor()
      Gets the cursor displayed when the user is pressing no modifier keys (indicating they wish to zoom-in on the canvas).
      Cursor getZoomOutCursor()
      Gets the cursor that is displayed when the user is pressing the shift key (indicating they wish to zoom out from the canvas).
      boolean isRecenter()
      Gets whether the canvas scroll position should be updated when zooming in or out to recenter the pixel that was clicked with the magnifier tool.

                         Point clickLoc)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component.

        mousePressed in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        clickLoc - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • zoomIn

        public void zoomIn()
        Multiplies the scale of the canvas this tool is currently active on by the value returned from getMagnificationStep(). Does not change the scroll position of the canvas.

      • zoomOut

        public void zoomOut()
        Divides the scale of the canvas this tool is currently active on by the value returned from getMagnificationStep(). Does not change the scroll position of the canvas.

      • getZoomCursor

        public Cursor getZoomCursor()
        Gets the cursor displayed when the user presses the control or meta key (indicating they wish to reset the canvas scale to 1.0).
        Returns:
        The reset-zoom cursor.

      • setZoomCursor

        public void setZoomCursor(Cursor zoomCursor)
        Sets the cursor displayed when the user presses the control or meta key (indicating they wish to reset the canvas scale to 1.0)
        Parameters:
        zoomCursor - The reset-zoom cursor.

      • getZoomInCursor

        public Cursor getZoomInCursor()
        Gets the cursor displayed when the user is pressing no modifier keys (indicating they wish to zoom-in on the canvas).
        Returns:
        The zoom-in cursor.

      • setZoomInCursor

        public void setZoomInCursor(Cursor zoomInCursor)
        Sets the cursor displayed when the user is pressing no modifier keys (indicating they wish to zoom-in on the canvas).
        Parameters:
        zoomInCursor - The zoom-in cursor.

      • getZoomOutCursor

        public Cursor getZoomOutCursor()
        Gets the cursor that is displayed when the user is pressing the shift key (indicating they wish to zoom out from the canvas).
        Returns:
        The zoom-out cursor.

      • setZoomOutCursor

        public void setZoomOutCursor(Cursor zoomOutCursor)
        Sets the cursor displayed when the user is pressing the shift key (indicating they wish to zoom out from the canvas).
        Parameters:
        zoomOutCursor - The zoom-out cursor.

      • getMagnificationStep

        public double getMagnificationStep()
        Gets the value by which the canvas scale factor is multiplied or divided when zooming in or zooming out. For example, when this value is 2.0, zooming in causes the scale factor to be multiplied by 2 thus scaling the canvas from its original size to 2x, then 4x, then 8x and so forth.
        Returns:
        The zoom in/out scale multiple

      • setMagnificationStep

        public void setMagnificationStep(double magnificationStep)
        Sets the value by which the canvas scale factor is multiplied or divided when zooming in or zooming out. For example, when this value is 2.0, zooming in causes the scale factor to be multiplied by 2 thus scaling the canvas from its original size to 2x, then 4x, then 8x and so forth.
        Parameters:
        magnificationStep - The zoom in/out scale multiple

      • isRecenter

        public boolean isRecenter()
        Gets whether the canvas scroll position should be updated when zooming in or out to recenter the pixel that was clicked with the magnifier tool. Has no effect when the active canvas is not embedded in a scroll pane and managed via a SurfaceScrollController.
        Returns:
        True if the clicked pixel will be centered in the scroll pane when zooming in or out; false otherwise.

      • setRecenter

        public void setRecenter(boolean recenter)
        Sets whether the canvas scroll position should be updated when zooming in or out to recenter the pixel that was clicked with the magnifier tool. Has no effect when the active canvas is not embedded in a scroll pane and managed via a SurfaceScrollController.
        Parameters:
        recenter - True to cause the clicked pixel to be centered in the scroll pane when zooming in or out.

      • getMinimumScale

        public double getMinimumScale()
        Gets the minimum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to. For example, when set to 1.0 the magnifier tool will not be able to zoom out (shrink the image) past its normal size.
        Returns:
        The minimum allowable scale factor this tool will adjust to.

      • setMinimumScale

        public void setMinimumScale(double minimumScale)
        Sets the minimum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to. For example, when set to 1.0 the magnifier tool will not be able to zoom out (shrink the image) past its normal size.
        Parameters:
        minimumScale - The minimum allowable scale factor this tool will adjust to.

      • getMaximumScale

        public double getMaximumScale()
        Gets the maximum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to. For example, when set to 32.0 the magnifier tool will not be able to magnify the canvas greater than 32x.
        Returns:
        The maximum allowable scale factor this tool will adjust to.

      • setMaximumScale

        public void setMaximumScale(double maximumScale)
        Gets the maximum allowable scale factor that this tool can adjust the active canvas to. For example, when set to 32.0 the magnifier tool will not be able to magnify the canvas greater than 32x.
        Parameters:
        maximumScale - The maximum allowable scale factor this tool will adjust to.
